newsitem.title: USA: Netscape to ship Netcaster this week.
newsitem.headline: Netscape to ship Netcaster this week.

text.p: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Aug 12 (Reuter) Netscape Communications Corp. said Tuesday it will ship Netcaster -- a long-awaited software product for sending news and information through the Internet -- later this week.
Netscape also has signed agreements with 700 media and entertainment companies to distribute up-to-the-minute news, financial information and sport scores to customers' personal computers.

Netcaster is a program that automatically pulls information off the Internet according to the tastes of each user. The software is part of Netscape's strategy to compete with Microsoft Corp. in making the personal computer a window to the global computer network.
Companies such as Walt Diney Co., News Corp.'s Fox News and financial information provider Standard & Poor's will announce "channels" through Netcaster later this week, Netscape officials said.
Netscape will ship Netcaster as part of Communicator, its flagship product for browsing information on the Internet. Netcaster will be available as a free download.
Mountain View, Calif.-based Netscape has been racing for months to get its product to market before Microsoft, which is planning a similar so-called "push" component for its Internet software.
